column5: How come its feels like im the only one working this Victorias Day? The streets are dead, and so are the sites and forums  Im not getting time and a half   Im on salary....and my company works on US holidays...problem is... im still working next monday too   (t-minus 2 weeks to camping  )  Am I the only one working? Anyone else?
I get the pleasure of goin in this afternoon.
Don't worry I work Friday - Monday.....no time and a half
The girlfriend is working. She works at tera's green houses
If you're on here... are you really working?
HAHAHAHAHAHAHA Im working hard... or hardly working
Think positive. You're getting paid to fritter away a miserable cold day. The rest of us are just frittering.  JF
I'm working...at home that is...just taking a little break.  Painting...the trim this time

I worked all day... As I drove past all the people going to whatever holiday arrangements they were heading too I smiled, every now and again working isn't so bad... specially when you cross the paths of the happy people out enjoying their day off!
I go in tonight at 11pm, so I guess I'm working on Victoria Day, even if it is only for one hour.

I was going to go pike fishing but when the weather was cold wet and windy. I went into work for 5 hrs at my part time job so I bascially have to work about 12 hours from now till Friday at both jobs. I considered it a good investment of time on account of the weather today.

I called a local Legend/Mercury dealer.....they picked up the phone...I did not expect that and asked my question.  I remember working for a store chain at their Oshawa location in the 90's.....it was dead dead dead....did not make 1 single sale. Toronto= busy  Durham = dead  forrest PS....I did not work.
